alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lake Santee, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Blooming Grove, Metamora, Laurel, Andersonville, Huntersville, Hamburg, Alpine, Peppertown, Everton and Buena Vista. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Indiana. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
